III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Description restraints; elimination of restraints
1

(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was slapped by another youth while being unnecessarily
restrained.
Investigation Interviews:
Case Management Supervisor was interviewed via phone on
6/9/2025. Case Management Supervisor reported having
concerns with Youth A being placed at the facility. Case
Management Supervisor reported the youth wanted a 1 on 1 staff
but the facility would not accommodate that. Case Management
Supervisor reported having concerns regarding Youth A being
held in a restraint when a youth who was not restrained came up
and slapped him.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 6/11/25. Chief Administrator reported being aware of an
incident in which Youth C slapped Youth A. Chief Administrator
denied awareness of a restraint taking place during the incident or
while Youth A was slapped. Chief Administrator reported police
were arriving on site as the situation was occurring to discuss a
sperate matter and escorted Youth A to the police car to assist in
calming him down. Chief Administrator reported having a 1 to 1
was something Youth A wanted, however, was not something
their staffing could allow for. Chief Administrator denied having
awareness at the time of Youth A’s referral to the program of any
justification Youth A would require a 1 to 1 staffing for care. Chief
Administrator reported had a high level of need been noted for
Youth A’s care at referral, he would not have been accepted into
the program.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth C got into an altercation while
playing basketball when Youth C hit Youth A on his arm at which
time Youth A yelled something at Youth C. Staff 1 reported things
escalated between them when both youth continued to yell things
to each other. Staff 1 reported he got in between them so they
could not hit one another and was facing Youth A when Youth C
ran around the group and slapped Youth A in the face. Staff 1
denied that Youth A was in a restraint when he was hit. Staff 1
2

reported he was not sure where the other staff were standing as
his attention was on Youth A while trying to calm him down with
verbal redirection. Staff 1 reported Youth A would ask for a 1 on 1
staff however it was not something required for his care. Staff 1
reported Youth A appeared to like the attention from adults and
staff was consistently with him.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Youth C presented with cognitive delay therefore struggled with
some of the interview process. Youth C reported he slapped
Youth A because Youth A threw his hoodie on the ground outside.
Youth C reported Staff 2 was present. Youth C was not able to
remember who else was there or what they were doing. Youth C
was not able to remember what Youth A was doing or what
anyone around Youth A was doing when he slapped him.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth C were having words on the
basketball court and began moving towards each other as if they
were going to fight so he and Staff 1, Staff 4, and Staff 5 placed
themselves between Youth A and Youth C to prevent them from
getting to each other to fight. Staff 3 reported he was facing Youth
A at the time when Youth C snuck around and slapped Youth A in
the face. Staff 3 denied restraining or anyone else restraining
Youth A at any time and denied Youth A being in a restraint when
he was slapped by Youth C. Staff 3 reported Youth A did require
attention however not to the extent of a 1 on 1 being required for
safety or care.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Staff 4 reported Youth A and Youth C were playing basketball
when they began arguing. Staff 4 reported he, Staff 3, Staff 5, and
Staff 1 were telling them to calm down and stepping between
them when Youth C ran up to Youth A and slapped him then ran
away. Staff 4 reported they then separated Youth C and Youth A.
Staff 4 reported Youth A struggled with aggression at times and
needed staff attention to clam down often. Staff 4 denied using
any restraints in this incident and denied Youth A being in restraint
when Youth A was slapped by Youth C.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Staff 2 denied being present for the incident. Staff 2 described
Youth A as a good kid who had a bad temper. Staff 2 reported
staff were always available to talk Youth A down from aggression
and intervene when necessary. Staff 2 denied knowing of any
reason Youth A would need a 1 on 1 staff consistently.
3

Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Youth D reported some youth were playing basketball at the time
when Youth C was not playing right which upset Youth A and they
started arguing. Youth D reported staff were trying to calm both
Youth A and Youth C when Youth C hit Youth A. Youth D denied
remembering which staff were there. Youth D reported staff were
getting in between them and trying to talk to them to calm them
down. Youth D denied anyone being restrained at any point.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Youth E reported youth were outside playing basketball when
Youth C stole the ball which made Youth A mad. Youth E reported
Youth C slapped Youth A. Youth E reported Youth A was in a
restraint at the time, against the fence. Youth E reported Staff 3
was one of the staff holding Youth E. Youth E could not remember
what any other staff or youth were doing at the time. Youth E
could not describe the restraint or what happened after.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Youth B reported Youth C slapped Youth A near the basketball
court. Youth B denied anyone being restrained by any staff before
or after the slap occurred. Youth B denied Youth A being
restrained anywhere outside or while being slapped. Youth B
reported staff were trying to redirect by talking to Youth A and
Youth C and getting in between them. Youth B could not
remember which staff were outside at the time.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/11/25.
Youth F reported he was playing basketball outside when he
turned and saw Youth C slap Youth A next to the basketball court.
Youth F denied Youth A being in a restraint at the time. Youth F
denied having any further details including who was present and
what staff were doing.
Youth A was interviewed via video conference on 6/27/25. Youth
A declined to respond to questions regarding what occurred near
the basketball court or being slapped. Youth A reported feeling
safe at the facility while he was there. Youth A denied having any
concerns or issues with any staff including Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3,
Staff 4 and Staff 5. Youth A denied anyone being injured including
himself the day of the incident on the basketball court. Youth A
declined to respond to any further questions.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 7/16/25. Staff 5 reported
assisting when Youth A and Youth C began arguing by stepping
between them and attempting verbal redirection. Staff 5 reported
Youth C was able to get around them and slap Youth A at which
time Youth A became irate and aggressive, attempting to go after
4

Youth C. Staff 5 denied that any staff restrained any youth and
denied Youth A being in a restraint when he was slapped by
Youth C. Staff 5 denied awareness or justification for Youth A to
be on a 1 to 1 prior to the incident however he was on one after
this.
Documentation Review:
• Incident Report (IR) dated 6/5/25 authored by Staff 5 states
Youth C and Youth A were becoming aggressive with one
another. IR states staff then intervened by attempting to
separate them by getting in between them and providing
verbal redirection when Youth C was able to approach
Youth A and slap him. IR documents Youth A becoming
aggressive with staff following the incident, attempting to
attack Youth C. IR documents police being on the scene
regarding an unrelated incident. IR documents police
escorted Youth A to the police car due to aggressive
behaviors.
• Discipline & Behavior Management Policy states verbal
redirection and separation of combative are to be utilized to
mitigate risk. Policy further states restraint should only be
utilized to prevent serious injury to the child.
• Employee Behavior and Discipline Reports for Staff 2 and
Staff 4. One included discipline for Staff 2 is related to
unjustified restraint from 5/2023. Staff 1, Staff 3, and Staff 5
have no discipline records on file.
• 2025 Training Records for Staff 1-5.
- Staff 1: 14.5 hours including CPI refresher and
mitigating risk.
- Staff 2: 27.5 hours including CPI Instructor
Training.
- Staff 3: 8 hours including CPI refresher.
- Staff 4: 12 hours including CPI refresher.
- Staff 5: 106.5 hours including initial CPI training
and shadowing experience.
Analysis There are no rule violations established regarding this allegation.
There is no sufficient evidence to support Youth A being
restrained at any point by staff during the incident as reported by
staff and youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
5

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
